articles.description: The 75th Cannes Film Festival wraps Saturday with the presentation of the Palme d'Or and other awards selected by the nine-member jury headed by French actor Vincent Lindon.
articles.title: Cannes to wrap with presentation of Palme d'Or on Saturday

articles.description: Top officials from California and New Zealand signed a pledge Friday agreeing to help fight climate change by sharing ideas and best practices, including how to put millions more electric vehicles on the road.
articles.title: California, New Zealand announce climate change partnership

articles.author: Jon Gambrell and Nicholas Paphitis
articles.description: Iran's paramilitary Revolutionary Guard seized two Greek oil tankers Friday in helicopter-launched raids in the Persian Gulf, officials said. The action appeared to be retaliation for Athens' assistance in the U.S. seizure of crude oil from an Iranian-flagged tanker this week in the Mediterranean Sea over violating Washington's crushing sanctions on the Islamic Republic.
articles.title: Iran seizes 2 Greek tankers in Persian Gulf as tensions rise

articles.description: Bollywood megastar Shah Rukh Khan's son was cleared on Friday in a drug case involving a party on a luxury cruise ship, with no evidence showing he possessed banned drugs or was involved in trafficking, India's narcotics agency said.
articles.title: Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan's son cleared of drug charges

articles.author: Maria Cheng
articles.description: The World Health Organization says nearly 200 cases of monkeypox have been reported in more than 20 countries not usually known to have outbreaks of the unusual disease, but described the epidemic as "containable" and proposed creating a stockpile to equitably share the limited vaccines and drugs available worldwide.
articles.title: WHO: Nearly 200 cases of monkeypox in more than 20 countries

articles.description: Turkey's foreign minister said Friday that Sweden and Finland must now take "concrete steps" to alleviate his country's security concerns to overcome Ankara's objections to their NATO membership bid.
articles.title: NATO: Turkey urges 'concrete steps' from Sweden, Finland

articles.author: Joseph Krauss
articles.description: The Al Jazeera news network says it will submit a case file to the International Criminal Court on the killing of reporter Shireen Abu Akleh, who was shot dead earlier this month during an Israeli raid in the occupied West Bank.
articles.title: Al Jazeera says it will go to ICC over killing of journalist

articles.author: Frank Jordans
articles.description: Officials from the Group of Seven wealthy nations announced Friday that they will aim to largely end greenhouse gas emissions from their power sectors by 2035, making it highly unlikely that those countries will burn coal for electricity beyond that date.
articles.title: G-7 pledges put coal on notice, could boost climate aid

articles.description: China on Friday criticized a speech by U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken focused on relations between the world's top two economic powers, saying the U.S. was seeking to smear Beijing's reputation.
articles.title: China criticizes US as tensions rise in South Pacific

articles.author: Ricardo Mazalan, Elena Becatoros
articles.description: Russian forces on Friday pounded the last Ukrainian strongholds in a separatist-controlled eastern province of Ukraine, including a city where authorities said 1,500 people have been killed and 60% of residential buildings destroyed since the start of the war.
articles.title: Russia squeezes Ukrainian strongholds in east

sources.title: Latest World News Headlines | Daily Telegraph

articles.description: Billionaire Elon Musk has weighed in on  the explosive Amber Heard-Johnny Depp defamation trial as the jury started deliberations following closing arguments.
articles.title: Musk breaks silence on ex-lover Heard’s trial

articles.description: Country music has long been closely linked to America’s pro-gun lobby, but several stars have distanced themselves from the National Rifle Association following the mass shooting at a Texas school.
articles.title: Sign the NRA might be in trouble

articles.description: A British conservative MP has resigned over the culture at Downing Street, underpinning the Partygate saga.
articles.title: British MP quits over Partygate saga

articles.description: The 18-year-old Texas gunman who massacred 19 children and two teachers at Robb Elementary School burst out of a closet and opened fire on US Customs and Border Protection tactical agents as they entered the classroom where he was barricaded, according to reports.
articles.title: Gunman’s chilling tactic during shooting

articles.description: A cause of death has been revealed for a boy whose body was found in a suitcase in Indiana, US, last month.
articles.title: Horror last moments of 5yo boy in suitcase

articles.description:
Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says Australia has “great friends” in the United States, Japan and India. 

In a wide-ranging interview with Sky News Australia, Mr Albanese spoke about the recent Quad meeting and unfolding issues in the region. 

“I’ve been very heartened by the conversations I’ve had with other world leaders,” he said.

Mr Albanese also discussed the issue of China and said it was in all our interests for there to be peace in the region and to “not talk up catastrophe”.
articles.title: Australia has ‘great friends’ in the US, Japan and India

articles.description: China has signed a diplomatic deal with Samoa – heightening western concerns it is attempting to expand its security presence in the Pacific.
articles.title: China signs deal with Samoa

articles.description:
More than 100 Australian Defence Force personnel are set to be deployed to Papua New Guinea over the coming months.

The troops are being sent to ensure the country's upcoming national election runs smoothly – amidst concerns of potential political and ethnic violence.

The ADF will also conduct joint training exercises with their PNG counterparts – including how to deal with cyber security threats.

A Defence spokesperson confirmed the Papua New Guinea government requested the support – as Australia and China tussle for influence in the Pacific.
articles.title: ADF troops to deploy to Papua New Guinea

articles.description:
The co-founder of the Japanese Red Army has been released from a Tokyo prison after serving a sentence of 20 years.

Fusako Shigenobu apologised for her involvement in the terrorist organisation following her release on Saturday.
articles.title: Terrorist group co-founder released from prison

articles.description: Samoa signed a bilateral agreement with China on Saturday, promising “greater collaboration” as Beijing’s foreign minister continues a tour of the South Pacific that has sparked concern among Western allies.
articles.title: Concerns over Samoa’s new pact with Beijing

articles.description:
Former US President Donald Trump has criticised the “grotesque effort” of human suffering to advance extreme political agendas – slamming President Biden’s “highly dangerous” rhetoric. 

Mr Trump said cynical politicians are “seeking to exploit the tears of sobbing families”.

“When Joe Biden blamed the gun lobby, he was talking about Americans like you,” he told the audience at the NRA conference. 

“He was shamefully suggesting that Republicans are somehow okay with letting school shootings happen,” he said. 

“This rhetoric is highly divisive and dangerous, and most importantly, it’s wrong.”
articles.title: Donald Trump slams Biden’s ‘dangerous’ rhetoric

articles.description:
Former US President Donald Trump has commemorated the “precious, young souls” of the victims in the Texas school shooting – while attending the NRA conference. 

Mr Trump asked members of the NRA for a moment of silence as he read the names of the children killed in the Texas school.

“Each precious young soul that was taken is an incomprehensible loss,” he said. 

“Stolen from us by a malice that no words can describe.”
articles.title: ‘Precious young souls’: Trump honours Texas shooting victims

articles.description: School shooter Salvador Ramos’ mum has attempted to justify his “reasons” for the horrifying Texas massacre that left 21 people dead and cried while asking the victims to “forgive her.” The 18-year-old gunman’s mum, Adriana Martínez Reyes, opened up in the wake of her son’s deadly rampage.
articles.title: ‘Had his reasons’: Killer’s mum’s shock claim

articles.description:
Texas Senator Ted Cruz has rallied at a National Rifle Association rally in Houston—slamming the media’s “dishonesty” and “cynicism”.

Mr Cruz said everybody is horrified by mass murders and pointed to the media’s blame on members of the NRA. 

“We must not react to evil and tragedy by abandoning the constitution,” he said. 

“Now is not the time for lies, or empty political gestures.”
articles.title: ‘Media dishonesty’: Ted Cruz rallies at NRA conference

articles.description:
Up to 200 Monkeypox cases have now been confirmed around the world. 

More than 100 suspected cases have also been reported worldwide – however the World Health Organization has ruled out the risk of an epidemic.

The UK has the largest number of confirmed cases - reaching 90 infections.
articles.title: 200 Monkeypox cases recorded worldwide

articles.description:
China and Russia have vetoed what would have become the UN's toughest sanctions to date on North Korea – over its intercontinental ballistic missile tests. 

The vote in the 15-member Security Council marks the first serious division among the five permanent members. 

A more united Security Council originally imposed sanctions after North Korea's first nuclear test in 2006 – and tightened them over the years.
articles.title: China and Russia veto new UN sanctions on North Korea

articles.description:
Former US President Donald Trump has called for a “top-to-bottom security overhaul” for schools across the United States – while he spoke at the NRA conference in Houston. 

Mr Trump said the gun control debate was part of “deep complicated issues” as he laid out a plan to secure school security.  

“Every building should have a single point of entry,” he said. 

“Above all, from this day forward every school in America should have a police officer or an armed resource officer on duty at all times.”
articles.title: ‘Deep complicated issues’: Trump calls for ‘security overhaul’

articles.description: Away from the frontlines, Ukrainians are doing everything they can to support their country's war effort.
articles.title: Ukrainian civilians helping war effort

articles.description: Twisted killer Salvador Ramos played sad music during his slaughter in Texas — which began when he told a teacher “goodnight” before gunning her down, a student survivor recalled in a harrowing new interview.
articles.title: Shooter’s chilling final words to teacher

articles.description: Donald Trump has told gun lovers today that “evil” exists in the world and that is one of the “very best reasons to arm law abiding citizens”.
articles.title: Trump’s wild solution to school massacres

articles.description: The partner of a teacher who died defending students from the Texas school shooter has tragically passed away just days later.
articles.title: Slain teacher’s husband dies ‘due to grief’ two days after Texas school shooting

articles.description: Shares in American guns and ammo manufacturers have skyrocketed in the wake of the Texas massacre.
articles.title: Gun stocks soar after Texas massacre

articles.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex will join The Queen at St Paul’s Cathedral next week for a thanksgiving service as part of her Platinum Jubilee celebrations.
articles.title: What to watch for in Harry and Meghan’s royal reunion

articles.description: A Year Four student has recalled how she survived the Texas school shooting by smearing blood on herself to pretend to be dead.
articles.title: Horrific way 11yo survived school shooting

articles.description: After watching her friend fatally shot in one of the US’s worst mass school shootings, 11-year-old Miah Cerrillo smeared the girl’s blood on her own body and “played dead”, ultimately saving her own life.
articles.title: Texas massacre horror: Girl smears herself with blood, plays dead

articles.description:
A recent statement released by French authorities has pledged France and Australia to “rebuild” a bilateral relationship – after accusing the previous Morrison government of a “breach of trust”. 

It comes as France accused its allies “of stabbing it in the back” – when Australia opted for nuclear-powered submarines to be built with US and British technology.

Following Australia’s federal election outcome, French President Emmanuel Macron called Prime Minister Anthony Albanese to congratulate him on his election win.

The full statement released by French authorities says:  

“After acknowledging the severe breach of trust following the decision of the previous prime minister, Scott Morrison to terminate the submarine contracts, the French president and Australia's prime minister have agreed to rebuild a bilateral relation based on trust and respect to jointly overcome global challenges, foremost among which is the climate emergency and the strategic challenges in the Indo-Pacific.”
articles.title: Albanese-Macron to mend Morrison’s ‘breach of trust’

articles.description:
ANU Department of Pacific Affairs Senior Fellow Graeme Smith says Foreign Minister Penny Wong has to offer the Pacific Islands that “China can’t offer”. 

Mr Smith said Ms Wong will bring pro-active foreign policy and will be an effective Foreign Minister. 

“What she’s got to do, and what she’s got to pitch …  is you have offer things that China can’t offer,” he told Sky News Australia. 

“Access to our labour markets … that’s what Pacific Islanders really want.”
articles.title: Penny Wong has to offer Pacific ‘what China can’t offer’

articles.description:
Jurors have finished hearing evidence from actors Johnny Depp and Amber Heard in their defamation trial.

Ms Heard returned to the stand for the last time ahead of closing arguments.

She claims she has been "harassed, humiliated and threatened" every day since accusing her former husband of physical and sexual abuse.

She was questioned if she was surprised by the number of people testifying against her.

British model Kate Moss denied rumours she was pushed down stairs by Mr Depp while they were dating.

Mr Depp has denied ever hitting Ms Heard.
articles.title: Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial hears final evidence

articles.description:
British supermodel Kate Moss denying Amber Heard's claim her former boyfriend Johnny Depp abused her was the "quickest testimony" of the whole trial, says Mitry Lawyers' Richard Mitry.

Mr Mitry said Ms Moss' testimony was not pivotal to the outcome of the case but was important because it "directly refuted" Ms Heard's claim about Depp in her statement.

During Ms Heard’s testimony, she mentioned Kate Moss and a rumour that the actor once pushed the model down a flight of stairs, leaving the door open for Depp’s legal team to bring her in to take the stand.

Ms Moss denied rumours she was pushed down stairs by Mr Depp while they were dating.

"By Kate Moss not only denying that in all of three minutes, which is probably the quickest testimony in this whole trial, categorically stating good things about him – naturally it's going to help his case."
articles.title: ‘Quickest testimony’: Kate Moss denied Amber Heard’s claim ‘in all of three minutes’

articles.description:
Residents in the eastern Ukrainian city of Severodonetsk are eking out their remaining resources as the city bears the brunt of Russia's new offensive in the Donbas region.

Relentless shelling has meant residents are sheltering almost constantly in bunkers and basements – where hunger and disease are rife.
articles.title: Severodonetsk under renewed Russian attack

articles.description:
As the gun control debate rages in the United States after the latest gruesome massacre at an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas, you can be pretty sure those who stand up for gun rights, harden on soft targets, and support the Second Amendment won’t actually read the text of the Second Amendment on air or in print.
Why would Second Amendment absolutists ignore the actual wording of the Amendment?  Because of the pesky second and third words in the text itself: “Well regulated”.
Here is the full text of the Second Amendment:

“A well-regulated militia, being necessary to the security of a free state, the right of the people to keep and bear arms will not be infringed.”

A SnapStream search of cable news shows that since the killing of 21 people in Uvalde, Texas, the term “well-regulated” h…
articles.title: Two Keywords of the Second Amendment

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Newsrust)
articles.description:
Twelve hours after a gunman entered Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, and killed 19 students and two adults, I learned he was “lonely” and “intimidated” for a stutter and a lisp.  I learned that the 18-year-old mass murderer plays video games like Fortnite and Call of Duty.  I learned that at one point the monster used a knife to cut his face.  I learned that on his 18th birthday, he bought two assault rifles    photos of which he took and posted them online with the caption “my weapons”.

I don’t care that he had a difficult upbringing.  I don’t care how hard college was for him.  I don’t care if he had a hard time making friends.

It’s not because I lack sympathy.  It’s because all my sympathy is exhausted for the carnage he left behind.  I care that 10 year old Jacklyn Jaylen Caz…
articles.title: Why I don't care about Uvalde's shooter life and you shouldn't either

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Newsrust)
articles.description:
Budget-conscious vintage car collectors, competing with Americans who have taken to vehicles as a hobby over the past couple of years, have found themselves increasingly out of the market for cars that were once considered fun and inexpensive and are now in high demand.  .  Undeterred, however, many shoppers are determined to find the next best thing.  Enter the substitution principle.
This is a financial term that has been appropriated, and somewhat inaccurately applied, by entry-level classic car buyers – those with around $25,000 to spend.  It’s a tongue-in-cheek answer to the question of what to buy when a coveted car has been appreciated beyond reach, an all-too-common occurrence during this time of wild hobby appreciation. articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Newsrust)
articles.description:
“If you swim at the same pace every day,” Ms. Lepinski said, “you won’t get as much benefit.”  On the one hand, she added, interval training is more fun.  “And two, that challenges your heart a little better.”
Mr. Ksebati and Ms. Lepinski said a good beginner or intermediate workout is 1,000 to 1,500 meters, or 20 to 30 laps, which should take around half an hour.  Start with a short warm-up — maybe a 4×50 at an easy pace — to get your heart rate up.  You can mix up different strokes, do breaststroke or backstroke rather than freestyle for some variety.  Then do a 4×25 using a plank to activate your legs.
Next comes the main set, or most of your workout.  If you’re working on speed, do 8×50 (eight rounds with a break after each) at a brisk pace.  If you want to increase your endurance, try a moderately paced ladder, going up and down the length of your intervals: 1×50, 1×100, 1×200, 1×100, 1×50.
Finally comes the return to calm, another 4×50 swim at a relaxed pace.  You can take a longer break – one or two minutes – between the warm-up, the main series and the cool-down.
It’s a bit confusing at first, but once you get the lingo down, you can follow almost any swim workout.  Want even more structure or a goal to achieve?  Apps like MySwimPro provide personalized workout plans, or you can find your local American masters swimmers crew.  (In the swimming world, “masters” simply means adult.)
Above all, enjoy the process.  For many swimmers, the water isn’t just a place to train, it’s also a sanctuary.  “It’s hard to think about the stress of the world when you’re wondering, ‘When is my next breath?  Where is the end of the pool?  What platform am I on?  said Ms. Lepinski.  “When you slip under water, the world goes away.”

Source Link
articles.title: 30 Minute Swim Workout - The New York Times

articles.description:
Also, look a little deeper and clay can give Gauff as much benefit as she gets out of it.  At 5-foot-9, Gauff is about the average height of top players these days, but she has long legs.  This can help her cover a lot of ground in a few quick steps, but it can make balls that sit low on grass and hard courts a little more difficult for her.
If there was a common thread running through Gauff’s first three matches, it was how often she was well placed.  The balls hit the clay and bounce right into her strike zone, giving her a series of belt-high fastballs she can play on, while taking advantage of the extra split second the clay gives her to put her feet or slide into position.
Always aggressive and on the hunt for forehands, she will inevitably make her share of mistakes, but so far she has hit more winners than unforced errors, which is always a good sign for any player.  She also rarely appeared unbalanced.
“I really like sliding,” she said.  “I think it helps me recover faster after I reach the ball. Then also, I mean, I play pretty hard on my forehand, so I think the clay bounces the ball even higher.
For her part, Anisimova, 20, also spent most of her childhood in Florida, but she said she became more comfortable on clay largely by playing numerous junior tournaments in the Latin American countries, where red clay is also much more common than her.  is in the United States.
Anisimova is a dangerous returner, capable of punishing slower serves, especially with her near-death backhand.  She also knows that her footwork and movement may be the weakest part of her still-developing game, and longer points on clay inevitably require her to cover more ground.  Clay makes his weakness a little less weak. 
“It gives me more time,” she said of clay after her victory over Muchova.  “Hard courts can sometimes be a bit too fast.”

A recent court ruling found that racism operates in the Greenfield Police Department.  Mayor Roxann Wedegartner’s response demonstrates that she is not listening to a diverse constituency and failing to collaborate with city officials and employees.  First, she said she would consider appealing the verdict (with taxpayers’ money).  She does not seem to grasp that racism is pervasive in all American institutions.  No matter how well-meaning European Americans are, change will never happen without this fundamental recognition.  The court’s decision is an invitation, a mandate, to review the policy and make amends.  Let the judgment be an opportunity for change, not hunkering down with secure blinders.  Second, alleging that he lied under oath, Wedegartner discharged the white police officer who testified on behalf of the black officer who brought the case.  And she confined him to his house during working hours!  Is she judge, prosecutor and jury?  I am delighted with the number of citizens who joined in testifying outside of City Hall as well as the members of Council who spoke.  In the civil rights movement of the 60s, a favorite freedom song was “Which Side Are You On?”  Mayor Wedegartner, which side are you on?
Adele Smith-Penniman
Wendell

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Newsrust)
articles.description:
More importantly, though, it negated nearly all of the reviews.  It was instructive, for example, to read most Madrid media accounts of the Mbappé deal.  Rather than a defeat for Madrid, Mbappé’s decision was presented as that of a mercenary and a traitor, a defector who gave his word to Pérez and then betrayed him.
Mbappé’s family were so distressed by this depiction that his mother decided to correct it publicly, claiming on Twitter that her son had never ‘gave his word’ to Real Madrid.
That he chose ‘El Chiringuito’ for his first appearance to discuss Super League was no accident either.  The show regularly features prominent Madrid supporters journalists known to burst into tears over the club’s successes, or rail against those – Gareth Bale, Eden Hazard – who are deemed to have brought dishonor to the club.
The spectacle is not, in this, an outlier.  Pérez oversees a vast network of soft news media, dependent not only on his grace and favor for information and access, but also intimidated by the breadth and weight of his business interests.  Pérez always claimed he was only powerful because he was Real Madrid president, but that’s not entirely true.  It is also powerful in many other ways.
This allowed him to lead Real Madrid as he sees fit.  Despite its size, the club’s hierarchy is relatively tight, with many recruitment decisions overseen by Pérez;  its general manager, José Ángel Sanchez;  and his chief scout, Juni Calafat.  Real Madrid is, in that sense, something of an aberration, almost a throwback to a time when most of its peers have diversified and deepened their personnel.
Pérez would say, of course, that it works: five Champions League finals in nine years is all the proof he needs.  This is perhaps his greatest gift.  No matter what he does, no matter how unlikely it seems, Pérez has a remarkable ability to emerge triumphant.
This may have been the year that destabilized the kingdom he so painstakingly built.  Rather, it could turn out to be the year that cemented him for good.

Source Link
articles.title: Real Madrid's Florentino Pérez is more powerful than ever

I did two combat tours in Iraq.  I never thought I would see weapons in my community reminiscent of the type that my Marines and I used on the battlefield.  Yet here we are again.  Nineteen children and three adults died in another senseless act of gun violence in my home state of Texas.  My heart is broken.  I’m frustrated.  I seethe. 

This tragedy comes just 10 days after a racially motivated mass shooting at a grocery store in Buffalo, New York, that killed 10 people.  Almost a decade after 20 freshmen and six adults were murdered in Newtown, Connecticut.  I mourn with the families of the victims and stand in solidarity with Uvalde, a small, predominantly Hispanic town 85 miles west of San Antonio. 

As a gun owner and veteran, I understand the many reasons for owning a gun.  I don’t u…
articles.title: Weapons like the ones I saw in Iraq were used in the Uvalde shooting

articles.author: noreply@blogger.com (Newsrust)
articles.description:
No man is an island — and perhaps, instead of an individual buyer, that’s why the affluent suburb of Darien, Connecticut is buying a large private island right in the heart of town.
The Wall Street Journal reports that the city – about 80 km from New York – concluded a contract to buy the roughly 60-acre Great Island, owned by the descendants of baking powder entrepreneur William Ziegler, for more than $100 million.  It is one of the largest remaining undeveloped parcels of land in the area. 
Ziegler, who died in 1905, bought it around 1900 to use as a summer residence.
“There will never again be an opportunity for the city to control the fate of this property, or add an asset to all of us like this,” Darien First Selectman Monica McNally said at an April meeting of the City Board of Selec…
articles.title: Connecticut town contracted to buy $100 million private island

articles.description:
Reuters: Russia shows off Zircon hypersonic cruise missile in test-launch at sea 
(Reuters) - Russia successfully test-fired a hypersonic Zircon cruise missile over a distance of about 1,000 km (625 miles), the defence ministry said on Saturday. 
The missile was fired from the Barents Sea and hit a target in the White Sea, it said. 
Video released by the ministry showed the missile being fired from a ship and blazing into the sky on a steep trajectory. 
President Vladimir Putin has described the Zircon as part of a new generation of unrivalled arms systems. Hypersonic weapons can travel at nine times the speed of sound, and Russia has conducted previous test-launches of the Zircon from warships and submarines in the past year.   
Read more ....   
Update #1: Russia test-fires its latest hypersonic Zircon missile (AP)  
Update #2: Russia Conducts Hypersonic Missile Test Near Finland & Sweden (Zero Hedge)   
WNU Editor: Russia, China, and the U.S. are the countries testing these missiles .... ‘National pride is at stake.' Russia, China, United States race to build hypersonic weapons (Science.org).
articles.title: Russia Test-Fires Its Latest Hypersonic Zircon Missile Near Finland And Sweden

articles.description:
Reuters: China signs deal with Samoa as Australia vows Pacific Islands plan 
SYDNEY — China’s foreign minister signed a deal with Samoa on Saturday to strengthen diplomatic relations, while Australia’s new leader said he had a “comprehensive plan” for the Pacific, as Beijing and Canberra continued rival campaigns to woo the region.
China is building on a security pact it recently signed with Solomon Islands, which has alarmed the United States and its allies such as Australia as they fear a stepped-up military presence by Beijing. 
Australia’s new center-left government has made the Pacific Islands an early diplomatic priority.   
Read more .... 
Samoa Signs China Bilateral Agreement   
Samoa signs China bilateral agreement during Pacific push by Beijing -- The Guardian  
Samoa signs China agreement amid South Pacific push -- AFP 
Samoa signs deal with China with talks underway for a police training centre -- SBS  
China’s Pacific plan seen as regional strategic game-changer -- AP  
A pivotal moment: Pacific faces a choice over China that will shape it for decades -- The Guardian
articles.title: Samoa Signs China Bilateral Agreement

articles.description:
RFE: Ex-President Poroshenko Says Blocked From Leaving Ukraine 
Former Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko said on May 28 that he was barred from leaving the country and accused the government of breaking a so-called political cease-fire in place since Russia invaded on February 24.
Poroshenko was in power from 2014 to 2019, and his European Solidarity party is the second-biggest party in Ukraine's parliament after President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's ruling Servant of the People party.    
Read more ....   
Update #1: Ukraine ex-president says blocked from leaving country (AFP)  
Update #2: Ex-president attempts to leave Ukraine – media (RT)   
WNU Editor: Poroshenko was invited to attend the NATO Parliamentary Assembly in Lithuania. It looks like some in the Ukraine government do not trust him to come back.
articles.title: Former Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko Says He Was Blocked From Leaving Ukraine

(Reuters) - The Iranian army has given some details - but not the exact location - of an underground base for its military drones, state media reported on Saturday, amid simmering tensions in the Gulf. 
State TV said 100 drones were being kept in the heart of the Zagros mountains, including Ababil-5, which it said were fitted with Qaem-9 missiles, an Iranian-made version of air-to-surface U.S. Hellfire. 
"No doubt the drones of Islamic Republic of Iran's armed forces are the region's most powerful," army commander Major General Abdolrahim Mousavi said. "Our capability to upgrade drones is unstoppable," he added.

WNU Editor: 100 drones in one location. Talk about a rich target in any conflict.

articles.description:
Bloomberg: Bankrupt Sri Lanka Takes Russia Oil as Fuel Crisis Persists 
(Bloomberg) -- Sri Lanka is receiving Russian crude oil that it will use to make fuel as the bankrupt nation faces crippling shortages of everything from gasoline to diesel. 
The Russian grade of Siberian Light will be processed at Ceylon Petroleum Corp.’s refinery in Sapugaskanda, Chairman Sumith Wijesinghe said in a phone interview. The country’s sole refinery is set to receive crude on May 28, enabling its restart for the first time in over two months, according to its power and energy minister in an earlier tweet. 
Sri Lanka is the latest Asian nation to accept Russian crude after Moscow’s invasion of Ukraine prompted widespread condemnation and sanctions. Most refiners in the US and across Europe have halted purchases from the OPEC+ producer, prompting the cost of Russian oil to plummet, while opportunistic buying from Asian customers in China and India has surged. 
Read more ....   
Update: Bankrupt Sri Lanka Takes Russian Crude As Fuel Crisis Depletes Stocks, Mulls Loan From China (Zero Hedge)   
WNU Editor: It looks like China is bailing out Sri Lanka .... China becomes wild card in Sri Lanka's debt crisis (ABC News).
articles.title: With No Fuel In The Country Sri Lanka Takes Russian Oil

A photo of some of the microchips Ukraine intelligence said it found in the communications system of a Barnaul-T air defense system. Ukraine intelligence photo.   
Warzone/The Drive: Captured Russian Weapons Are Packed With U.S. Microchips 
Ukraine intelligence showed us lists of mostly U.S.-made microchips it says were found on captured or destroyed Russian military equipment. 
When Ukrainian forces began to take apart several pieces of captured or partially destroyed Russian military equipment, they found a strong reliance on foreign microchips - especially those made in the United States - according to component lists Ukraine intelligence shared with The War Zone. 
The chips in question were found inside a recovered example of the 9S932-1, a radar-equipped air defense command post vehicle that is part of the larger Barnaul-T system, a Pantsir air defense system, a Ka-52 “Alligator” attack helicopter, and a Kh-101 (AS-23A Kodiak) cruise missile.   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: Good luck on trying to regulate where microchips can be exported.
articles.title: Captured Russian Weapons Are Packed With U.S. Microchips

Inceptive Mind: Northrop Grumman’s B-21 Raider stealth bomber completes load testing 
Northrop Grumman successfully completed the first and most critical loads calibration test of the first B-21 raider nuclear bomber. 
The B-21 aircraft is preparing for its first flight in 2023, more than a year later than early estimates. 
The recent test is one of the three major conditions the aircraft will undergo in this phase of ground testing as it progresses toward its first flight. The load calibration test focuses on calibrating instrumentation prior to the flight and verifying structural integrity and has yielded positive and consistent results.

Service members of pro-Russian troops drive a tank along a street past a destroyed residential building during Ukraine-Russia conflict in the town of Popasna in the Luhansk Region, Ukraine May 26, 2022. REUTERS/Alexander Ermochenko 
Bloomberg: Russian Wins in Eastern Ukraine Spark Debate Over Course of War 
(Bloomberg) -- Russian troops are making steady progress in Ukraine’s east on the back of more-concentrated artillery and air power, now controlling almost all of the Luhansk region and threatening to encircle thousands of Ukraine’s most experienced troops. 
That is sparking fears that Russia could be poised for a bigger breakthrough, and leading to increasingly panicked calls from Kyiv for even more powerful offensive weapons. 
Russia’s capture of a series of towns including Popasna means its forces hold 95% of the Luhansk region that makes up the northern half of the Donbas area. 
On Friday, Ukraine’s military command said Russian troops were pushing on from Popasna toward the town of Bakhmut, 32 kilometers (20 miles) west, seeking to isolate Ukrainian forces in a pocket of government-held territory around Sievierodonetsk.   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: The main stream media's coverage of the war has definitely changed in the past week .... Washington Post Admits That The Ukraine Front Lines Are Collapsing. Even Ukraine President Zelensky is changing his narrative, albeit slightly .... Ukraine needs to face reality and talk to Putin, Zelenskiy says (Reuters).
articles.title: Is A Debate On The Course Of The Russia - Ukraine Starting?

Bloomberg: Colombian Voters Seem Headed Toward a Radical Shift on Sunday 
(Bloomberg) -- Colombians head to the polls on Sunday amid strong indications that the anti-establishment mood sweeping Latin America could lead them to abandon the pro-business Washington-centered model they’ve embraced for decades. 
Presidential frontrunner Gustavo Petro, 62, a one-time guerrilla and later Bogota mayor, has tapped especially younger voters’ yearning for radical change, pledging to tax wealthy landowners, go green by phasing out oil and coal and restore ties with the socialist government next door in Venezuela.

Military.com: Navy Leader Floats Idea of Selling Troubled Littoral Combat Ships to South America 
The Navy's top uniformed leader told Congress that the U.S. government should consider selling ships from its troubled littoral combat fleet it plans to decommission to countries in South America. 
The Navy has faced sharp criticism for its latest plan to decommission all of its Freedom-class littoral combat ships. 
The youngest ship, USS St. Louis (LCS-19), was commissioned less than two years ago in August 2020. 
"We should consider offering these ships to other countries that would be able to use them effectively," Adm. Michael Gilday said when asked by Sen. Jerry Moran, R-Kan., about the Navy's plan to decommission nine of the ships in its upcoming budget proposal at a Senate committee hearing Thursday.

articles.description:
Russian Central Bank @Reuters   
Reuters: Brussels says about $24 bln of Russian central bank assets frozen in EU, less than expected 
BRUSSELS, May 25 (Reuters) - European Union states have reported the freezing of about 23 billion euros ($24.5 billion) of assets of the Russian Central Bank, a top EU official said on Wednesday, revealing for the first time a figure that was expected to be much higher. 
Russia has publicly said that Western sanctions led to the freezing of about $300 billion of its central bank's assets globally. 
Of these frozen assets, only less than one-tenth is in the EU, according to information that the European Commission has collected from the 27 EU governments, EU Justice Commissioner Didier Reynders told a news conference.
He said that about 23 billion euros had been frozen in the EU since the start of the war in Ukraine in February, a figure that is dwarfed by the $100 billion frozen by the United States.   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: This is far less than the $300 billion that was previously reported. The U.S. says they have seized $100 billion. Reuters is also saying that its sources in Moscow are saying that worldwide $300 billion in assets has been frozen. But I have been following this story since day one. And if you dig deep the Kremlin and the Russian Central Bank have never officially said how much money has been seized.  
I know two months before the invasion the Kremlin told many Russian companies to pull out their money from the West in the event of more sanctions being imposed. It looks like many followed this warning. It also looks like the Russian government has far more money than what they are acknowledging.
articles.title: EU Says That Only About $24 Billion Of Russian Bank Assets Have Been Frozen, Far Less Than What Was Expected

Leaked copy of draft shows Beijing wants more involvement in policing, cybersecurity and marine mapping 
China is pursuing a sweeping regional economic security deal with Pacific nations that would dramatically expand its influence and reach into those countries, in a pact that has western countries and some Pacific leaders deeply worried. 
The wide-ranging deal lays out China’s vision for a much closer relationship with the Pacific, especially on security matters, with China proposing it would be involved in training police, cybersecurity, sensitive marine mapping and gaining greater access to natural resources.

Gen. Cavoli is nominated to be NATO's next commander.  
The US general nominated to be the next commander of NATO suggested in a Senate hearing on Thursday that he may offer military options to facilitate grain exports from Ukraine and help break Russia’s blockade of Ukraine’s southern coast. 
When asked what NATO could do about Russia’s blockade, Gen. Christopher Cavoli, who currently serves as the commander of US Army Forces in Europe and Africa, said if he’s confirmed, he would “provide the military options required by our civilian leaders.”

— Mark Ames (@MarkAmesExiled) May 26, 2022
   Washington Post: Ukrainian volunteer fighters in the east feel abandoned 
DRUZHKIVKA, Ukraine — Stuck in their trenches, the Ukrainian volunteers lived off a potato per day as Russian forces pounded them with artillery and Grad rockets on a key eastern front line. Outnumbered, untrained and clutching only light weapons, the men prayed for the barrage to end — and for their own tanks to stop targeting the Russians. 
“They [Russians] already know where we are, and when the Ukrainian tank shoots from our side it gives away our position,” said Serhi Lapko, their company commander, recalling the recent battle. “And they start firing back with everything — Grads, mortars. 
“And you just pray to survive.”    
Read more ....

articles.description:
Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, © Mikhail Tereshchenko/TASS   
TASS: West has declared total war on Russian World — Lavrov  
The top diplomat warned that the Western policy of "cancelling" Russia would continue for a long time 
MOSCOW, May 27. /TASS/. The West has declared a total war on Russia and the Russian world, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said on Friday. 
"The West has declared a total war on us, on the Russian World. Nobody makes any secret of this," Lavrov said at a meeting of the Council of the heads of Russia’s constituent territories at the Foreign Ministry. 
Lavrov warned that the Western policy of "cancelling" Russia would continue for a long time.   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: This is a transformation for Lavorv. From saying in March that the West has declared ‘total war’ on Russia (link here), to total war on the "Russian world". He is tapping into the perception among many Russians that the West is waging a Russiaphobe campaign. 
Russian Foreign Minister Says The West Has Declared Total War On The Russian World   
West Waging Total War Against Russian World Using Russophobia and Cancel Culture, Lavrov Says -- Sputnik  
West declared total war on Russian world – Moscow -- RT  
West has declared 'total war' on Russia: Lavrov -- CNA/AFP
articles.title: Russian Foreign Minister Says The West Has Declared Total War On The Russian World

Moldova's former President Igor Dodon before a court hearing in Chisinau, Moldova on Thursday, May 26, 2022 [Vladislav Culiomza/Reuters]   
DW: Moldovan ex-president detained for alleged graft, treason  
Ex-Moldovan President Igor Dodon is accused of taking bribes. The pro-Russia politician was in office from 2016 until 2020. 
Igor Dodon, the pro-Russia ex-president of Moldova, has been arrested in Chisinau on suspicion of high treason, according to multiple media reports on Tuesday. 
Dodon has been detained by authorities for 72 hours, Deschide.MD quoted Moldova's acting prosecutor general, Dumitru Robu, as saying.   
Read more ....

Russia Warns Moldova Over Ex-President As Supporters Protest Detention (RFE), and here .... Russia Says Will Monitor Moldova Ex-Leader's Case (Moscow Times/AFP).

Members of the United Nations Security Council gather during a meeting about the situation in Venezuela, in New York, US, February 26, 2019. REUTERS/Shannon Stapleton    
The Hill: US effort to impose tougher UN sanctions on North Korea blocked by China, Russia  
China and Russia on Thursday blocked an effort to impose tougher sanctions on North Korea at the United Nations Security Council that was led by the U.S. after North Korean leader Kim Jong Un conducted a spate of missile tests this year, including the launch of several intercontinental ballistic missiles. 
Both China and Russia hold veto powers at the U.N. Security Council, which they exercised after the introduction of the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea (DPRK) — North Korea’s official name — for the tests with more restrictive sanctions.   
Read more ....   
Update #1: China, Russia veto U.S. push for more U.N. sanctions on North Korea (Reuters)  
Update #2: China and Russia veto new UN sanctions on North Korea (AP) 
 WNU Editor: China and Russia vetoed the resolution. The council’s 13 other members voted in favor.
articles.title: China, Russia Veto U.S. Sponsored Resolution Pushing For More U.N. Sanctions On North Korea

In this File photo from 2020, a US soldier sits at a Multiple Launch Rocket System (MLRS) after an artillery live fire event by the US Army Europe's 41st Field Artillery Brigade in Germany.    
CNN: US preparing to approve advanced long-range rocket system for Ukraine 
Washington (CNN)The Biden administration is preparing to step up the kind of weaponry it is offering Ukraine by sending advanced, long-range rocket systems that are now the top request from Ukrainian officials, multiple officials say. 
The administration is leaning toward sending the systems as part of a larger package of military and security assistance to Ukraine, which could be announced as soon as next week. 
Senior Ukrainian officials, including President Volodymyr Zelensky, have pleaded in recent weeks for the US and its allies to provide the Multiple Launch Rocket System, or MLRS. The US-made weapon systems can fire a barrage of rockets hundreds of kilometers — much farther than any of the systems Ukraine already has — which the Ukrainians argue could be a gamechanger in their war against Russia.   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: These rockets can hit deep into Russia. This will be seen by Moscow as a major escalation .... US warns Ukraine about escalation – media (RT).
articles.title: U.S. To Approve Sending To Ukraine The Multiple Launch Rocket System, Or MLRS

U.S. Marines load an M777 towed 155 mm howitzer into the cargo hold of a U.S. Air Force C-17 Globemaster III transport plane, to be delivered in Europe for Ukrainian forces, at March Air Reserve Base, California, U.S. April 21, 2022. Picture taken April 21, 2022. U.S. Marine Corps/Cpl. Austin Fraley/Handout via REUTERS.   
Reuters: Exclusive-U.S. and Ukraine Discuss Danger of Escalation as New Arms Extend Kyiv's Reach 
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - As the United States and its allies provide Ukraine with increasingly sophisticated arms, Washington has held discussions with Kyiv about the danger of escalation if it strikes deep inside Russia, U.S. and diplomatic officials tell Reuters. 
The behind-the-scenes discussions, which are highly sensitive and have not been previously reported, do not put explicit geographic restrictions on the use of weapons supplied to Ukrainian forces. 
But the conversations have sought to reach a shared understanding of the risk of escalation, three U.S. officials and diplomatic sources said.   
Read more ....

articles.title: Washington Raises Concerns With Kyiv On Using U.S. Weapons To Strike Targets Deep In Russia

articles.description:
OilPrice.com: Here's How Russian Crude Is Finding Its Way To Customers 
* Refinitiv Eikon: Greece has emerged as a new hub for Russian oil via ship-to-ship (STS) loadings. 
* Vortexa: Russia has been increasing fuel exports to Greece, with shipments set to jump to about 2.5 million barrels. 
* Trading Russian crude and oil products remain legal for now. 
Small tankers and ship-to-ship transfers are being used to keep the flow of Russian oil to China steady, Bloomberg reported this week, citing sources from the brokering industry.
Typically, the report notes, Russian ESPO crude is shipped directly to China. But lately, buyers are opting for loading the crude on small tankers and shipping it to South Korean waters, from where it is loaded onto supertankers and then taken to China. 
According to Bloomberg’s sources, the change is a result of reprioritization among buyers as shipowners avoid loading Russian oil because of Western sanctions. Currently, almost all of the ESPO available for sale is going to China.   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: As high as oil prices are right now, I shudder when I think on what would happen if all Russia oil and energy exports are banned. The cost of oil would then go through the roof. 
This Is How Russian Oil Is Finding Its Way To Customers   
Russia's Oil Export Loophole Runs Through Greece -- OilPrice.com  
China is shuttling small ships to tankers at sea to transport cheap Russian oil amid sanctions, report says -- Insider  
Rare Ship-to-Ship Transfers Keep Oil Moving From Russia to China -- Bloomberg  
An oil trading company named Bellatrix is one of the under-the-radar firms that has taken over from the big names in shipping Russian crude -- Insider
articles.title: This Is How Russian Oil Is Finding Its Way To Customers

articles.description:
Saudi oil production hit 10.3 million barrels in April. Photo credit should read MARWAN NAAMANI/AFP   
Rigzone/Bloomberg: Saudi Arabia Making $1B From Oil Exports Every Day  
Saudi Arabia’s oil exports reached $30 billion in March, the highest in at least six years, driven by a rally in oil prices and rising production. 
The value of crude exports, now almost $1 billion a day, increased by 123% year on year, the kingdom’s statistics office said. 
Saudi Arabia’s crude production rose to 10.3 million barrels a day in March, with Brent oil prices averaging $112 a barrel. Prices have jumped almost 50% this year, mostly due to the fallout of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. 
The higher revenues helped the kingdom post a 57.5 billion riyal ($15 billion) budget surplus between January and March. It will be one of the fastest-growing large economies in the world this year, according to the International Monetary Fund. 
Read more ....   
Update #1: Saudi Arabia oil exports soared to the most since 2016 in Q1 thanks crude prices above $100 a barrel and higher production (Insider)  
Update #2: Saudi Arabia Tucks Away Billions in Oil Money for Next Year (Bloomberg)   
WNU Editor: I would not be surprised if they will be making more per day in the coming months as oil prices continue to rise.
articles.title: Saudi Arabia Is Now Making $1B From Oil Exports Every Day

articles.description:
New York Times: Documents Shed Light on Secret U.S. Plans for Apocalyptic Scenarios 
WASHINGTON — Newly disclosed documents have shed a crack of light on secret executive branch plans for apocalyptic scenarios — like the aftermath of a nuclear attack — when the president may activate wartime powers for national security emergencies. 
Until now, public knowledge of what the government put into those classified directives, which invoke emergency and wartime powers granted by Congress or otherwise claimed by presidents, has been limited to declassified descriptions of those developed in the early Cold War. 
In that era, they included steps like imposing martial law, rounding up people deemed dangerous and censoring news from abroad.   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: Here are some of the measures that the US government will impose in an extreme emergency .... Presidential Emergency Action Documents (Brennan Center For Justice).
articles.title: Recently Released Documents Show What The U.S. Goverment Will Do If An Apocalypse Occurs

Women move food from a distribution site on the outskirts of Herat, Afghanistan in 2021. © WFP/Marco Di Lauro   
Afghanistan: Nearly 20 million going hungry  
Nearly 20 million people in Afghanistan – almost half the population – are facing acute hunger, humanitarians warned in a UN-backed report, published on Monday. 
The latest Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) analysis for the country also revealed a pocket of “catastrophic” levels of food insecurity in the northeast, affecting thousands. 
The analysis was conducted in January and February by partners who include the UN Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), sister agency the World Food Programme (WFP), and many non-governmental organizations.    
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: The UN has updated its report .... 1.1 million Afghan children could face severe malnutrition (ABC News/AP).
articles.title: UN Report Says Nearly 20 Million Afghans Are Facing Acute Hunger

Adviser to the Minister of Energy of Ukraine Olena Zerkal noted that Ukraine has a powerful lever of influence on Hungary - the Druzhba pipeline. 
As for Hungary, Hungary has taken advantage of the situation, and in fact we and the European Union have given it such an opportunity ... Their appetite for European Union funds is growing daily. And they.ve decided, it is their prime time to demand anything, so as not to destroy European unity, "Zerkal was indignant.

articles.description:
Reuters: EU to make breaking sanctions against Russia a crime, seizing assets easier 
BRUSSELS (Reuters) - The European Commission proposed on Wednesday to make breaking European Union sanctions against Russia a crime, a move that would allow EU governments to confiscate assets of companies and individuals that evade EU restrictions against Moscow. 
Breaking EU sanctions on Russia is now a criminal offence in 12 EU countries. It is either an administrative or a criminal offence in 13 and two treat it only as an administrative offence, Justice Commissioner Didier Reynders said. Penalties for sanction breaking across the EU vary accordingly. 
The Commission proposal aims to unify that approach to make sanctions evasion a serious crime in all members of the 27-nation bloc, he told a news conference. 
Read more ....   
Update #1: Brussels proposes plan to confiscate frozen Russian assets to help rebuild Ukraine (Euronews)  
Update #2: Brussels outlines plan to facilitate seizure of Russian oligarchs’ frozen assets (Financial Times)  
Update #3: EU Proposes to Make Breaking Russia Sanctions a Crime (Antiwar.com)     
WNU Editor: There is a lot of money on the table that the EU wants to grab .... Russia's $300bn on table in EU talks on war repairs (EObserver).
articles.title: EU Proposes Plan To Make Breaking Russian Sanctions A Crime And To Confiscate Frozen Russian Assets To Help Rebuild Ukraine

Japanese and U.S. forces conducted the joint fighter jet flight over the Sea of Japan, Japan’s Defense Ministry said Thursday, in an apparent response to a Russia-China joint bomber flight while U.S. President Joe Biden was in Tokyo. (Joint Staff of the Japanese Self-Defense Force via AP) 
ABC News Australia: US and Japanese warplanes in show of strength following North Korean missile launches 
US jet fighters have joined Japanese warplanes in a show of strength, a day after North Korea launched ballistic missiles into the waters separating it with Japan. 
The exercise was meant to "showcase combined capabilities to deter and counter regional threats", the US military said in a statement. The flight of eight aircraft consisted of four American F-16 jets and four Japanese F-15 warplanes, according to Japan's Air Self-Defence Force. 
Japan and the United States wanted to show their combined resolve in the wake of North Korea's latest missile launches, two US officials told Reuters anonymously.

articles.description:
Only China appears to have a reasonable inventory cushion against the unexpected, according to a new BofA Global Research report. 
Rigzone: Oil Inventories Down to Dangerously Low Point 
 Crude oil inventories are down to a dangerously low point across Europe, North America, and OECD Asia just as OPEC+ spare production capacity has dwindled to the lowest levels since April 2020. 
That’s according to a new BofA Global Research report, which was sent to Rigzone on Monday. The report also highlighted that petroleum product inventories have fallen to “precarious levels” for middle distillates and gasoline “as the market heads into the peak of the U.S. driving season”. 
“As a result, refined petroleum cracks have recently spiked to record levels, contributing to boost volatility across the oil complex,” the BofA Global Research report stated.   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: I am resigned that this is going to last for years .... High Gasoline And Diesel Prices Are Here To Stay (OilPrice.com).
articles.title: Global Oil Inventories Down To Dangerously Low Point

articles.description:
Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh. 

We interviewed 8 eyewitnesses, reviewed 11 videos from different angles and worked with an experienced forensics team. All the evidence points in one direction.@CNN https://t.co/pHwOk3VsCe
— Celine Alkhaldi سيلين الخالدي (@celinealkhaldi) May 25, 2022
   CNN: 'They were shooting directly at the journalists': New evidence suggests Shireen Abu Akleh was killed in targeted attack by Israeli forces 
(CNN)Several shots ring out in quick succession, cutting through a clear, blue spring morning in Jenin, in the West Bank. Crack, crack, crack, crack, crack, crack, crack. 
The cameraman filming the scene scrambles backwards to take cover behind a low concrete wall. Then a man cries out in Arabic: "Injured! Shireen, Shireen, oh man, Shireen! Ambulance!" 
When the camera operator pans around the corner, Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh can be seen lying motionless, face down on the ground as another Palestinian reporter, Shatha Hanaysha, crouches down beside her, using a tree trunk for cover. Hanaysha reaches out and tries to rouse her as gunshots continue.   There's no response. Both women are wearing helmets and blue protective vests marked "Press."   
Read more ....   
Update: Israeli Forces Murdered Star Al Jazeera Journalist: CNN (Zero Hedge)   
WNU Editor: Will Al Jazeera Journalist Shireen Abu Akleh is an American. Will she be treated in same manner as Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi when he was murdered by Saudi authorities?
articles.title: CNN Says Their Investigations Show Israeli Forces Targeted And Murdered Star Al Jazeera Journalist Shireen Abu Akleh

articles.description:
The Gepard antiaircraft tank of the German armed forces Bundeswehr fires during a demonstration at the exercise area of Munster about 80 km south east of Hamburg June 20, 2007. REUTERS/Christian Charisius/File Photo   
Reuters: Tanks, but no ammo – Germany's Ukraine pledges show military muddle 
BERLIN (Reuters) - Four weeks ago, Germany agreed to send dozens of anti-aircraft tanks to help defend Ukraine from Russia's invasion, part of what it called a turning-point after decades of military restraint. 
Berlin says it can deliver the first Gepard tanks in July.  That's too slow, a Ukrainian parliamentarian said on Tuesday, as Russian forces launched an assault on the country's east. 
"For us, July is like, 'what?'" Anastasia Radina, a member of the Ukrainian parliament, told Reuters at the World Economic Forum. 
"Let me put it like this: Let's ask a mother who is forced to sit in a basement with her newborn child who has no baby formula. ... How far from now is July for her?"   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: Germany also has a problem with Poland on the issue of tanks .... Germany ‘flabbergasted’ at Poland’s accusation of broken promise on tanks (Politico). Not surprising, Russian media is having a field-day on this issue .... Germany ‘perplexed’ by Poland’s accusations (RT).
articles.title: Germany's Promise To Send Anti-Aircraft Tanks Hits A Snag. Late Delivery And No Ammo
